results.title: Extending the subject (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Anthony Cash, Roger Owen and British Broadcasting Corporation

results.title: Extending the skill range
results.creator_credit: Don Kelly and Gerard Holdsworth Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Judo”.
Demonstrates various judo movements including uchimata, osotagake and their avoidances; straight and bent armlocks; randori as part of training.

results.title: Expulsion
results.brief_description: A meticulous reconstruction of five crucial days in the life of a college for children in their last school year in Berkshire. A drug ring was discovered at the school. This led to mass expulsions, and to a tragic and unforeseen sequel. The film brings the problems of children and drugs to the fore and emphasises the need to take a stand on the issue.

results.title: Expressionism
results.creator_credit: George Barford, Egons Tomsons and International Film Bureau
results.brief_description: Traces the development of the basically German Expressionist Movement which exaggerated both color and form to express emotional and psychological attitudes. Includes the work of Munch, Kirchner, Heckel, Schmidt-Rottluff, Nolde, Pechstein, Kokoschka, Bdckmann, Kandinsky, Marc and Klee. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: Exposure
results.creator_credit: Thorold Dickinson and United Nations. Film Board
results.brief_description: A compilation of footage showing the plight of the world’s homeless estimated at 40 million after World War II. Includes pictures of refugee life in the hope of raising international public awareness and support to help the refugees.

results.title: Export action. no. 39
results.brief_description: Part of a series encouraging Australian manufactures to pursue export markets. Examines the case of a West Australian pyjama manufacturer who, with government assistance, broke into the Malaysian and Singaporean pyjama markets.

results.title: Exploring your growth
results.creator_credit: Churchill-Wexler Film Productions and Heath Elementary Science
results.brief_description: Uses simple animation and photomicrography to explore the process that makes a person grow. Explains how food is digested in the mouth, stomach, and intestine; how the digested food is carried by the blood from the intestine to the cells of the body; and how food allows cells to grow and divide, causing growth.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Churchill-Wexler Film Productions and Heath Elementary Science

results.title: Exploring the unwritten past
results.brief_description: A description of scientific investigation into the past, and modern techniques in archaeology. Shows how the fascinating story of man in Britain, covering the earliest discovery of the great antiquity of mankind in Kent’s Cavern in Devon to the decorative arts of the Celtic Iron age and the coming of the Romans, is being unravelled by experts. Illustrates the changing way of life through outstanding sites and monuments, together with objects which have played a part in piecing together the story.
